title: Heatstroke: Campaigns under blazing sun continue even after third advisory on heatstrokes | Pune News - Times of India
text: Pune: The health department has now issued a third advisory to the administration to ensure that enough arrangements are made at mass gatherings and at voting booths to prevent any untoward incident.However, despite such advisories, political leaders and star campaigners continue to hold rallies in the afternoon. The state has already reported 200 heatstroke cases from the beginning of March till May 5.The state health department has reported 202 heat stroke-related cases between March 1 and May 5 this year. Majority of such cases (23) was reported from Nashik, followed by 21 from Buldhana and 20 each from Dhule and Jalna. In view of this, the health department issued a fresh advisory on May 3 to ensure that all appropriate medical arrangements are in place prior to any mass gathering.On May 3, health services commissioner Dheeraj Kumar in a letter to all district collectors, civic body commissioners and chief executive officers said that the India Meteorological Department (IMD) had predicted that the intensity of heat wave was going to escalate further this month so in view of that all government hospitals must prepare a cold room to cater to heat stroke cases.Pune collector Suhas Diwase said, “This is an advisory, and political parties are also responsible institutions. With regards to ensuring proper medical aid and infrastructure in place, we do advise organisers to make sure that all medical aid, drinking water facilities and sheds are in place so that there is no repeat of any untoward incident like last year.” Jalgaon collector Ayush Prasad said, “We have identified the vulnerable population in the district, like pregnant and lactating mothers, those with comorbidities and tuberculosis patients. We have also stocked polling booths with ORS packets, IV drips, hypertension and diabetes tablets.” We also published the following articles recentlyAmid heat advisory, voters urged to take precautionIMD issues heat advisory for Goa before Lok Sabha elections. Dry weather with high temperatures expected. Voters cautioned about heat-related illnesses. Vulnerable groups advised to prevent dehydration.
